title: Enhancing Learning Design Practical Competencies: Theory-Based Instructional Design for Improving e-Learning Course Quality

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Instructional design competency enhancement program for professionals in education/teaching/learning fields

learning_goals: Learners can explain five e-learning course design principles linked to learning theories.
Can design activity plans incorporating learner motivation and feedback mechanisms

Within a 6-month course, learners will design and prototype two types of 10-minute mobile-optimized educational content, considering at least three device constraints (screen size, network speed, data capacity) of mobile devices (smartphones, tablets).

Learners will design one integrated assessment system combining formative (quizzes, observational records) and summative assessments (practical exams, portfolios) for vocational training settings and produce a report meeting at least four of the institutionâ€™s five evaluation criteria (validity, practicality, fairness).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
